description:
I use this music player because it has an integrated file browser in the side panel: a folder or individual files can be dragged and dropped in a playlist on the right.

I don't like music players that import the music into a database, I prefer to organize my music directly in the filesystem, by creating folders and sub-folders (sorted by genre/artists/albums).
summary: With an integrated file browser in the side panel

description:
I changed Appearance -> Alpha transparency (check)
when I try to enter 'Preferences' it crashes. (#Appearance, Playback)
Sometimes Exaile plays well but it suddenly crashed.
Doesnt works on CentOS 7. Just crashes on start

I used to use exaile in the days of the Music Player Wars (2005 to 2012) and preferred it over Banshee and amaroK. I was a linux newbie and was finally getting picky about things like the HIG. Exaile worked, it offered everything in a nice clean package. Some settings are a bit quirky to find and the toolbar is still from the old days, but it is a very nice replacement for (my still loved) Quod Libet.
